questions.question: Why is the orthogonality of the Alamouti matrix critical in a fading channel?

answers.a: It enables use of lower-order modulation schemes
answers.b: It ensures that symbol interference can be completely eliminated at the receiver
answers.c: It allows simultaneous transmission from more than two antennas
answers.d: It increases the carrier frequency separation

explanations.a: Orthogonality is independent of modulation scheme choice.
explanations.b: Correct. Orthogonality ensures symbols remain separable under linear decoding.
explanations.c: Alamouti is specifically designed for two transmit antennas.
explanations.d: Carrier frequency is not influenced by the matrix design.

questions.question: In what scenario would the Alamouti scheme fail to maintain its performance guarantees?

answers.a: When noise is Gaussian and white
answers.b: When transmit antennas experience correlated fading
answers.c: When BPSK is replaced with QPSK
answers.d: When receiver noise floor is low

explanations.a: This is a standard assumption and does not harm performance.
explanations.b: Correct. Correlated fading negates spatial diversity benefits.
explanations.c: Alamouti supports any modulation; QPSK works too.
explanations.d: A low noise floor improves, not harms, performance.

questions.question: Which signal processing assumption is vital at the receiver in the Alamouti scheme?

answers.a: Signal phases are random and uniformly distributed
answers.b: Channel coefficients are estimated with zero error
answers.c: Received signals can be sampled at twice the symbol rate
answers.d: The two transmit signals have identical power levels

explanations.a: Phase randomness does not affect decoding structure.
explanations.b: Correct. Perfect CSI is assumed for linear decoding.
explanations.c: No oversampling is needed for Alamouti decoding.
explanations.d: Power balance helps, but decoding depends on CSI accuracy.

questions.question: Why is Alamouti encoding considered unique among space-time block codes?

answers.a: It is the only code that supports 64-QAM modulation
answers.b: It achieves full diversity with a simple linear decoder and orthogonal code
answers.c: It uses feedback from receiver to transmitter
answers.d: It does not require synchronization between antennas

explanations.a: Modulation schemes are separate from encoding structure.
explanations.b: Correct. Alamoutiâ€™s linear decodability and orthogonality are unique in 2x1.
explanations.d: Antenna synchronization is assumed for coherent reception.

questions.question: If the channel varies significantly within two Alamouti time slots, what is the mathematical impact?

answers.a: The matrix becomes ill-conditioned, leading to noise amplification
answers.b: The decoding matrix becomes non-orthogonal, breaking linear separation
answers.d: The system adapts automatically using time-interleaving

explanations.a: Alamouti does not rely on matrix inversion.
explanations.b: Correct. Channel variation disrupts orthogonality needed for decoding.
explanations.c: Convolution is irrelevant to Alamouti structure.
explanations.d: Time-interleaving is not part of standard Alamouti.

questions.question: Which factor determines the diversity order in a 2x1 Alamouti system?

answers.a: The number of independent fading paths

explanations.a: Correct. Diversity depends on the number of independently fading links.
explanations.b: Bandwidth affects ISI, not diversity order.
explanations.c: Modulation affects data rate, not diversity.
explanations.d: SNR affects performance, but not diversity order.

questions.question: In Alamouti decoding, how is interference between two transmitted symbols avoided?

answers.b: Through spatial filtering at the receiver
answers.c: By exploiting the orthogonality of the encoding matrix

explanations.b: No beamforming or spatial filtering is involved.
explanations.c: Correct. Orthogonal encoding separates symbols in receiver space.
explanations.d: Guard intervals are not used for Alamouti decoding.

questions.question: Why is Alamouti considered optimal for a 2x1 MISO system under Rayleigh fading?

answers.a: It maximizes capacity regardless of SNR
answers.b: It achieves the full transmit diversity bound
answers.c: It reduces BER for high-order QAM more than MRC
answers.d: It requires feedback to adapt transmission

explanations.a: Capacity is not always maximized; it's diversity that is optimal.
explanations.b: Correct. It achieves full diversity with simple decoding.
explanations.c: BER improvement is due to diversity, not modulation specific.
explanations.d: No feedback is needed in standard Alamouti.

questions.question: What happens if transmit antennas are too close together in the Alamouti scheme?

answers.a: Channel correlation increases, reducing effective diversity
answers.c: Symbol rate increases due to antenna coupling

explanations.a: Correct. Closely spaced antennas see similar fading, reducing diversity.
explanations.b: The matrix remains decodable; singularity isn't caused by spacing.
explanations.c: Symbol rate is unaffected by antenna spacing.
explanations.d: Interference may increase, but not in the form of duplication.

questions.question: Which element ensures that the Alamouti receiver can linearly separate the original transmitted symbols?

answers.a: The channel impulse response is symmetric
answers.b: The Gram matrix of the code is diagonal
answers.c: Pilot symbols are inserted before every frame
answers.d: The number of receive antennas is greater than one

explanations.a: Symmetry of channel is not assumed.
explanations.b: Correct. The orthogonal Alamouti code yields a diagonal Gram matrix, allowing separation.
explanations.d: Even a single antenna can decode the Alamouti scheme.
